heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 20 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.8°C) and outside temperature (down 4.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 6.5°C), cloud levels (up 249 m), dew point temperature (up 5.6°C), and outside temperature (up 5.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 127.4m higher than yesterday, 236.0m higher than the past week, 248.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 841m to a maximum of 1909m, averaging 1588.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1352.0m and 1836.8m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and very little to no wind will be present. Chance of light rain, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dark. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
